titleStmt.title: Elizabeth by the grace of God Queene of England, France and Ireland ... to all and singuler archbishops, bishops ... whereas we are credibly giuen to vnderstand, as well by the pitifull supplication and petition of our poore and true subiects ... of our townes of Pensance, Mousehole, and Newlin ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.

notesStmt.note: For 2-year collection for relief of Penzance, Mousehold, and Newlin, pillaged by pirates.
"VVitnesse our selfe at Kew, the second day of October, in the seuen and thirtieth yeere of our reigne."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
